dialogue_line: We definitely need to come up with a different plan to amuse ourselves. What do you think would be fun?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I can't find my purse!

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: What was in your purse?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: It contained my wallet and passport.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: How much money was in your wallet?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: There was about $200 in my wallet, and I had some traveler's checks in there, too.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We can call American Express to deal with the traveler's checks. How about credit cards?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: I had a MasterCard and a Visa Card.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We can look at the back of my cards to get the emergency phone numbers.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: Where do I report that my passport is missing?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: We need to take a cab to the embassy to report that right away. They will help us.

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport
dialogue_line: What did you have in your purse?

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport

title: . Losing the Wallet and Passport

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Is there anything special I need to think about as I tour this city?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: You need to keep in mind that this is a very poor country. Things are a little more desperate here than you are used to.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: What do I need to look for?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Be particularly vigilant anytime you are in a crowded place with other tourists. Pickpockets know that tourists aren't paying all that much attention.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: I have seen many children on the street begging, so what do I do about them?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: It is best not to give money to children or other beggars on the street, as they can swarm you. You can give money to a local charity.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Should I be concerned about what I eat or drink?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Do not drink any water that isn't bottled. Avoid street vendor food.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: How about being out on the street at night?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: I would take a cab to your destination at night. Don't walk down the street alone.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: This city is much larger than the one I live in, and I wonder if there is anything special that I need to keep in mind.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Crime can happen anywhere, but it is a little worse here because of the poverty.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Should I be vigilant about anything in particular?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: The train stations, airports, and tourist sites are favorite spots for pickpockets.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: When I see children on the street begging, what amount should I give them?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: I wouldn't suggest giving money to them. Most of them are put out there by adults who then take their money.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Can I eat or drink anything I want to?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Do not use tap water at all, not even to brush your teeth. Only eat fruit that has been peeled.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Can I walk around and see the sights at night?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: I would be sure to travel in a group at night. Stay in well-lit areas.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Do I need to take any special safety precautions in this city?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: This is a very large city with a lot of crowds to work your way through. Keep in mind that poverty makes people a little more desperate.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: What should I watch out for?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: You have to pay special attention at train stations, airports, and tourist sites. They are known for having a lot of pickpockets.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: There are so many children begging on the street that I don't know which ones to give money to.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: It is a natural instinct to want to give money to those children, but it is better to give money to one of the local charities or schools.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Are the local food and drink safe?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: Avoid eating food prepared by street vendors. Use only bottled water.

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: How safe is it to be out at night?

title: . Being Cautious in a Big City
dialogue_line: You should always travel with others at night and stick to well-lit areas.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This is really a fascinating city!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, this city is thousands of years old and has quite a history!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I really love this temple we are visiting.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: As you enter the temple, please remove your shoes as the others are doing.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: It is so quiet here.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, they are showing respect to their gods. People come here to pray and meditate.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I noticed that the women all have some sort of head covering.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: It is a tradition that women cover their heads while in the temple.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I noticed that all of the people were eating with their hands at dinner last night.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, that is another custom that people practice here.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I have never traveled to a place that was so different from my home.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, this city has a fascinating and diverse past. It is thousands of years old!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This temple is beautiful!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Please make sure that you remove your shoes before you enter the temple.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: It is very quiet in here even though there are a lot of people in this area.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, even the children are expected to be respectful and quiet here. People need quiet to meditate.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: The women all seem to have beautiful scarves or veils on their heads.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Women in this society would not consider setting foot in a temple without their head being covered.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: I noticed at dinner last night that people in this country like to use their bread to eat with instead of silverware.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, that bread is made of a special texture that works well for that.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This city is certainly very different from what I am used to at home.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This is an amazing city. It is quite ancient with a diverse past!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: What an amazing temple!

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: See how everyone is removing their shoes before entering? We need to do the same.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: The people in this room are very quiet.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: This is an area of peace and tranquility. It is expected that people keep their voices down out of respect for those who are meditating.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: The women's scarves are quite beautiful.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Women of this faith must have their heads covered to enter the temple.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Last night at dinner, I noticed that everyone was using bread to eat with instead of silverware.

title: . Local Customs
dialogue_line: Yes, eating your curry or vegetables with your bread is a custom in this country.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Is this where I catch the Super Shuttle?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Yes, this is where you catch the Super Shuttle. Where are you headed?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am headed home to Pasadena.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: You can tell where each van is headed by the name on the front of the van. I am the driver for Glendale, but your van should be along in a minute.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Do you know how much it costs to get to Pasadena?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I believe the cost of that trip is sixty dollars.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Do you know if the shuttle goes directly to Pasadena, or does it make a lot of stops?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Before you pay the driver, you need to ask him. He needs to be upfront with you about the number of stops he will be making.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Do I need to have exact change?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: You don't need exact change, but it is useful to have smaller bills.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: They told me inside that I should catch the Super Shuttle here.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: You are in the right place to catch the Super Shuttle. What is your destination?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am trying to get to my home in Pasadena.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Look at the sign on the front of the van to tell where each van is headed. My van is going to Glendale, but yours will be along in minute.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: How much does a trip to Pasadena cost?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: If I remember correctly, that trip costs sixty dollars.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I am hoping that this shuttle goes straight to my city without making a bunch of stops.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Always ask the driver how many stops he plans to make before you pay him.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: If I have large bills, should I break them while I am waiting?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: It is better if you have cash close to the amount of the fare. There is an ATM machine right over there.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: Am I in the right place to catch the Super Shuttle?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: This is the Super Shuttle stop. Where are you trying to get to?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: My final destination is my home in Pasadena.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: The destination of each van is always written across the top. I have Glendale written on mine, but your van will be here shortly.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: What is the price of a shuttle trip to Pasadena?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: The trip to Pasadena costs sixty dollars.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: I need to know if this shuttle is going to make a lot of stops or go straight to Pasadena.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: If you find out the driver will be making too many stops on the way, you may wish to wait for a more direct shuttle.

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: What should I pay the driver with?

title: . Shuttle Bus at the Airport
dialogue_line: There is an ATM machine over by that wall. It is best if you have bills close to the amount that you will owe.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: It's great to be home!

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you have a nice trip?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: It had its surprises, but when all was said and done, it was a good trip.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: What was your favorite part?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I loved our full moon beach party.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: What were the people like? Were they friendly?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: The people were basically quite friendly.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you bring me anything?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I brought you a lovely souvenir that I will be giving you for your birthday next week.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I can't wait until I get to be the one to go on vacation.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I love traveling, but I love coming home, too!

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you enjoy your vacation?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: It had its ups and downs, but I really enjoyed it.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: What did you like the best?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I absolutely enjoyed the kayak trip we took to an outlying island.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you enjoy the people there? Did they like you?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Most of the people seemed happy that we were there, but some of them really resented visitors.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: What did you bring back for me?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: I did get you something, and I will give to you as soon as I unpack.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Next time, I am going to save up my money and go with you.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: How nice it is to be home again with all of my family!

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did your journey turn out as well as you had hoped it would?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: All trips have good and bad points, but this one had mostly good ones.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you have something you enjoyed the most?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: My favorite thing was the amazing food.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Were the people receptive to having visitors?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: You could tell that some people did not have a favorable view of Americans.

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Did you get me a souvenir?

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Of course I brought you something!

title: . Arriving Home
dialogue_line: Next time I am going to be the one to go away, and you can stay home and feed the dog!

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: The front desk told me to ask you for sightseeing advice.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: Of course. I'd be more than happy to help. I am, after all, the hotel's concierge.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: Concierge? What exactly is that?

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: We advise you on where to visit, eat, or shop during your stay here in New York.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: Great! So where should I start my sightseeing?

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: The Statue of Liberty is always a good place to begin.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: I saw the Statue of Liberty on my last visit here. Can you recommend somewhere else?

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: Hmm. What type of interests do you have?

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: In my spare time, I really like to view art and go running.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: Aha! Have you been to Central Park or the Museum of Modern Art?

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: No, but I've heard a lot about both.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: Well, Central Park is wonderful for running. Afterwards, you should head to the Museum to enjoy the art.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: Great! That sounds like a plan. Thanks a lot.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: I'm sure you'll have a good time there.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: I was told to see you about going sightseeing.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: It's my pleasure. I'm the hotel's concierge, at your service.

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice
dialogue_line: Concierge? Could you explain that to me?

title: 4. Asking the Concierge for Sightseeing Advice

title: 7. Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (1)
dialogue_line: I have a little problem with room 507.

dialogue_line: I found cockroaches in my room.

dialogue_line: I've seen at least nine different cockroaches in my room.

title: 8. Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

title: 8. Calling to Report a Cockroach Problem (2)

dialogue_line: This room is unacceptable. I want a new one, and I want a refund for tonight.

title: 9. Asking about the Hotel Gym

dialogue_line: Pardon me. Does your hotel have a fitness facility?

dialogue_line: No, sir. The gym is absolutely free. However, be sure to take your room key with you.

dialogue_line: When does the gym open and close?

dialogue_line: The hours couldn't be better, 24/7.

dialogue_line: Very good. Now, is there a trainer down there?

dialogue_line: Do you have a place where I can exercise?

dialogue_line: Yes, sir. We have a fine exercise facility.

dialogue_line: Is the hotel going to charge me a dollar a minute for gym use?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: I would like to make an offer on this house, but I don't know much about the process.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: As your realtor, I am here to take care of this process. How much were you planning on offering?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: I really like the house and will pay the full asking price of three hundred and fifty thousand dollars.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: We want to leave ourselves some bargaining room. Let's offer three hundred and twenty thousand dollars.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: That sounds good, but I don't want this house to get away from me.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: The market is fairly down right now, so the offer is a realistic one.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: When will we know if they accept the offer?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: The owners usually respond to an offer within a few days.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: Should I be contacting my bank in the meantime?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: You are already pre-qualified for your loan, so you are in good shape.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: I have never bought a house before and don't know how to make an offer.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: The process of actually making the offer is something that I will take care of for you. What price were you considering offering?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: I love this house and would be willing to pay the full asking price of three hundred and fifty thousand dollars.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: Let's leave some room on this offer. I think that three hundred and twenty thousand dollars is a fair offer in this housing market.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: We could try that, but I really want this house!

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: It is common practice to offer and then have a counter-offer.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: How long will it take to find out if they are going to accept the offer?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: The sellers are usually fairly quick to respond. They want to get things moving.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: Should I tell my bank that I have made an offer?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: There really isn't anything else to do right now except wait. You are already pre-qualified for your loan.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: I have never done this before and don't know where to begin as far as making an offer on this house.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: Leave the details of making the offer up to me. What were you thinking you should offer?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: I absolutely must have this house and will pay three hundred and fifty thousand dollars or more.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: It is best to start a little low on the first bid to allow for a counter-offer. How about offering three hundred and twenty thousand dollars?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: I hope that the owners aren't insulted by that offer.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: Your offering price is not out-of-line. The owners will either take it or make a counter-offer.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: Does it usually take very long for the owners to get back to you with an acceptance?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: It usually doesn't take very long for owners to respond to an offer.

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: Should I be in touch with my bank to tell them to get the loan papers ready?

title: 6. Making an Offer through a Realtor
dialogue_line: The only thing you should do now is relax. You already are pre-qualified for your loan.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Have the owners come up with a counter-offer to my offer to buy their home yet?

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: The owners have counter-offered three hundred and thirty-five thousand dollars.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Should I accept their offer?

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: There are two ways to respond. You can either come back with another offer or go with their counter-offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: What if I make another offer, and they don't accept it?

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: No one else has made an offer, so you could make another offer if you want to do so.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: I think that I would like to offer three hundred and thirty thousand dollars as a counter-offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: OK, I will present your counter-offer to the owners tonight.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: How long before I find out what their decision is?

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: By now, the owners probably have a pretty good idea of what they will accept. It will go quickly.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Your office called and said that the owners had made a counter-offer to my offer to purchase their house.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: To your offer of three hundred and twenty thousand dollars, the owners have counter-offered three hundred and thirty-five thousand dollars.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: I think that maybe I should accept their offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: You, of course, have two ways of responding. You can say yes or come up with another offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: I want to make another offer, but I am afraid that they will decline and I will lose this house.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: There is always a chance that someone could outbid you, but you could try one more offer if you like.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: I would now like to offer three hundred and thirty thousand dollars as a counter-offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: After the owners get home from work tonight, I will approach them with your offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Can you tell me how long it will take them to get back to me?

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: I don't think that it will take as long as the response to the first offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Have the owners answered back with a counter-offer for my offer to purchase the house?

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: In response to your offer, the sellers have decided to counter-offer three hundred and thirty-five thousand dollars.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: That sounds pretty good to me, but I am not sure what to do.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: You can accept this offer or decline it and come up with another offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: If I make another offer and they refuse, then what?

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Personally, I would consider making one more offer, but it is up to you to decide what to do.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Let's try going with three hundred and thirty thousand dollars for a counter-offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: I will contact the sellers with your current offer.

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Do you think that this will move along fairly quickly?

title: 7. Discussing Counter-Offer with a Realtor
dialogue_line: Usually the response to the second offer moves along a bit more quickly than the first one.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Did you get a chance to speak with the sellers about my counter-offer?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Yes, and I think I have good news for you.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Did they accept the counter-offer?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Yes, they accepted your counter-offer, but they want you to pay for the home inspection.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: How much will that cost?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: It will cost you around five hundred to one thousand dollars for a home inspection.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Can I choose the home inspector?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Yes, you are paying for it, so you get to choose. I would pick the best one.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: So, when are you going to inform the owners of my acceptance?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: I will call the owners right now. They will be happy to hear the good news.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: I was anxious to find out what the sellers had to say about my counter-offer.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: I was able to contact them so, if you'll step into my office, we'll talk.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Did they go with the proposed counter-offer?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: They want you to pick up the cost of the home inspection, but they accepted your offer.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Is a home inspection very expensive?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: It can cost between five hundred and one thousand dollars.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Do I get to choose who inspects the home?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Yes, you get to choose. I would spend a little more to get a really thorough inspection.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Can you call the owners with my acceptance right away?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: I am going to contact the sellers immediately. They were looking forward to your acceptance.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Were you able to contact the owners about my counter-offer?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Yes, please have a seat, and we'll discuss this right now.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: I hope that they accepted the counter-offer.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: The counter-offer was acceptable to them, but they want you to pay for the home inspection.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Will the home inspection cost me a lot?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: It can cost as little as five hundred dollars and as much as one thousand dollars.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Is it my choice as to who inspects this house?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Yes, it is your choice as you are paying for it. Make a wise investment and choose the best inspector you can find.

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: How long until you contact the sellers with my acceptance?

title: 8. Re-offering and Acceptance
dialogue_line: Let's call them right now. I am sure that they will be happy to hear that you have agreed to pay for the inspection.
